questions.guidance_text: Enter the full legal name of your business as registered with government authorities. This name will appear on your insurance policy and all official documents. Ensure accuracy as any discrepancy may cause issues during claims.

Provide your complete business address where all insurance-related correspondence will be sent. Include building name/number, street, area, city, state, and PIN code. This address is crucial for receiving policy documents and renewal notices.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Shop No. 12, Trade Center, MG Road, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, 600001

questions.guidance_text: Select how long you need marine insurance coverage. Single transit covers one-time shipment, while annual policies cover multiple shipments throughout the year. Longer periods often offer better premium rates and continuous protection.

Specify when your goods will begin their journey from the origin point. Coverage typically starts when goods leave the warehouse or seller's premises. For import shipments, this is when goods are loaded at the foreign port.

Enter the expected date when goods will reach the final destination. Coverage continues until goods are delivered to your warehouse or 60 days after arrival at destination port, whichever is earlier. Allow buffer time for unexpected delays.

Provide the anticipated date when your cargo will be loaded onto the vessel or transport vehicle. This helps insurers track your shipment and assess seasonal risks like monsoons or rough seas that might affect transit.

Specify the starting point of your cargo journey including city and country. For imports, mention the foreign port or city. For domestic transit, provide the warehouse or supplier location. This helps assess route-specific risks.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Shanghai Port, China or Mumbai, Maharashtra

questions.guidance_text: Enter the final delivery location where your goods will be received and unloaded. Include city and state for clarity. Coverage typically extends to your warehouse or the buyer's premises as specified in the sales contract.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Chennai Port, Tamil Nadu or Delhi NCR

questions.guidance_text: Select how your cargo will be transported. Sea freight is economical for bulk cargo but takes longer. Air freight is faster but costlier, suitable for high-value or time-sensitive goods. Premium rates vary by transport mode due to different risk levels.

Describe how your goods are packed for transit. Proper packing reduces damage risk and affects premium rates. Professional packing with adequate cushioning and weatherproofing is essential for marine transit. Poor packing may lead to claim rejection.

Provide detailed description of goods being shipped including quantity, weight, and specifications. Be specific - instead of 'electronics', write 'Samsung LED TVs 55-inch, 100 units'. Accurate description ensures proper coverage and smooth claim settlement.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Cotton fabric rolls, 500 pieces, each 100 meters, Grade A quality, for garment manufacturing

questions.guidance_text: Select the category that best describes your cargo type. This classification helps insurers understand handling requirements and risk factors. Hazardous goods, perishables, and fragile items typically attract higher premiums due to increased risk.

Enter the total commercial invoice value of your cargo in Indian Rupees. Include the cost of goods plus freight charges (CIF value). This becomes your sum insured - the maximum amount payable in case of total loss. Under-declaring value may result in proportionate claim settlement.

Indicate if you're importing goods from another country. Import shipments have additional considerations like customs clearance, duty payments, and longer transit times. Coverage can extend from foreign warehouse to your Indian premises.

questions.question_text: Do you wish to cover Import Duty?
questions.guidance_text: For imports, you can insure the customs duty amount separately. If goods are damaged after duty payment, you lose both the goods value and paid duty. Duty insurance ensures you recover this additional financial loss.

Enter the estimated customs duty amount you'll pay for this import shipment. Calculate based on current duty rates for your product category. This amount is added to cargo value to determine total coverage. Check CBIC website for latest duty rates.

Upload relevant documents like commercial invoice, packing list, bill of lading, or previous marine policy if renewal. For imports, include purchase order or LC copy. Clear documentation speeds up policy issuance and claim processing.
